title: Adhesive gel bonds to eye surface, could repair injuries without surgery

title_detail.value: Adhesive gel bonds to eye surface, could repair injuries without surgery

summary: An adhesive gel packed with light-activated chemicals can seal cuts or ulcers on the cornea -- the clear surface of the eye -- and then encourage the regeneration of corneal tissue, according to a preclinical study. The new technology, named GelCORE (gel for corneal regeneration), could one day reduce the need for surgery to repair injuries to the cornea, including those that would today require corneal transplantation.
